text: Donacaula uxorialis is a moth in the family Crambidae. It was described by Harrison Gray Dyar Jr. in 1921. It is found in North America, where it has been recorded from Florida and Texas. The length of the forewings is 16–25 mm. The forewings are yellowish white, irrorated (sprinkled) with brown and with yellowish-white scales at the costal margin. The hindwings are yellowish white. Adults have been recorded on wing from January to October.Moth Photographers Group at Mississippi State University ==References== Category:Moths described in 1921 Category:Schoenobiinae
title: Donacaula uxorialis
